basic_data.name: Luzia - A Waking Dream Of Mexico

reviews.title: What a disappointment
text: We saw Toruk last year and were blown away by the performance. Expected more of the same but were very disappointed.

The most impressive part of the show being the beginning with the horse, all went downhill after that. This was boring and poorly executed with the acrobats unable to go through the hoops with out knocking them down, more like a bad pantomime.

reviews.title: The show was nice but very far away my expectations
text: I kept on saying for years that I want to go and see CDS. So finally, this year, afara a friend suggested it, because he heard from another friend that the show was great, I decided to spare £100 and finally go and see the magic of CDS. But oh boy, what a big big disappointment. The acrobatic was not exactly jaw dropping, not to mention the number of mistakes /accidents that we unfortunately witnessed and the pantomime show was definitely something I would have liked not to be included in this performance. I mean, when you pay a lot of money for a show, you cannot help yourself to not have great expectations. I mean, a bit more action. I still think CDC deserves its respect for its contribution to the artistic industry, but this show is really disappointing. If I would have bothered to research more about the show, I would have definitely saved myself now £100.

reviews.title: An Underwhelming CDS
text: If you're going to charge a lot for a show, then make it great.
Of all the CDS I have watched, this one falls below average.
The Water Feature is great, but then undone by the endless time it takes to clean after which is subsequently filled with poor fillers.
The main performances - the swinging in particular looks spectacular, but is not as complex when they keep the swings stationery in order for the acrobat to land. It should be more daring than that.
There were a number of blunders from the hoops being hit and the juggler losing his batons a few times amongst others.
For me at least, Cirque needs to go back to the acrobatic thrills and not rely on pantomime - it's not why I go. I have genuinely seen far better Cabarets.
Having said all of that, I still obviously have great respect for the performers as it's still an incredible skill - even those who faulted, but it needs to be a tad more bold.

reviews.title: Don't Bother.
text: I have seen about 6 Cirque shows and this was by far one of the worst ones. Overall it was very boring and the acts were just basic compared to the standard I've seen previously. The first half was boring but the second half was a little bit better. There was no Wow factor. I wish I had read all the reviews before seeing this show.

reviews.title: Surprisingly bad
text: We went to Luzia in the Royal Albert Hall in London. I visited many CDS shows and this was really the worst one. The majority of the time is spent on stupid jokes and the guy with the whistle who’s meant to be entertaining but he did such a poor job that only one kid among thousands of visitors was laughing the majority of the time. A lot of time is spent on cleaning and their materials are not used in the best way. They used the water a lot but actually the majority of the scenes didn’t include it yet it took so much time to clean it up, and that time was filled with weird jokes.
Each show scene was very long with few exceptionally hard tricks, but for a 7-10 minute turn it’s too little.

The jiggling guy did a poor job too. In fact he was only jiggling up to 4 sticks at a time what is average for the industry and when he got the 5-7th ones, he just through them in the air once and than caught them. So it wasn’t really jiggling, it was just throwing stuff in the air in order and then catching it in said order.

The last episode with the swings was also not impressive. At difficult acrobatic technics the receiving swing was paused so that the gymnast would 100% land on it, but what’s the point of the swings then, if at the end the gymnast lands not on the swing that is moving but on a concrete and solid thing. Very, very disappointing. Paid £114 per person and didn’t really get the show that I was expecting.

reviews.title: Spellbinding, mesmerising show in an iconic building.
text: This show lived up to and beyond our expectations, throughly enjoyed from start to finish. Truly amazing and so different from anything else we have seen. Absolutely fabulous, the artists defy gravity and logic. Mystifyingly beautiful, seeing is believing and all this in the iconic beautiful building The Royal Albert Hall. Wow a must see in our opinion.

reviews.title: Very average indeed
text: I was so looking forward to my first ever trip to this show. I treated my friend to a ticket for Christmas & we were both so underwhelmed. Great venue but slow show, with not enough acrobatic talent seen.

reviews.title: Disappointing show
text: We went to see cirque du Soleil Lucia at the royal albert hall. It was a present for my birthday but I must say it was a bit disappointing. We saw ovo and that was amazing which is why we went again. This show didn't have as many wow moments and the content was limited. Too much of the guy whistling and too many simple things like juggling and football skills. Also the water used in the acts meant there was a lot of time wasted cleaning up. It was ok but not really worth the £94 paid for the ticket. Merchandise was also over priced.

reviews.title: Very disappointing
text: Nowhere near as good as previous cirques which had us on the edge of our seat. Seemed pretty basic for that level and the ‘filling’ time done by an actor was awful and I was sat there wondering why we had paid £80 a ticket. Not worth it and the organisers need to consider giving people a show worth that kind of money.
Would not recommend.

reviews.title: Great experience for a meh show
text: To be honest the show wasnt that great by itself... A couple impressive acts but overall a meh show. However if you are yet to go to the Royal Albert Hall, you MUST go. Amazing venue.

reviews.title: Summer in the city
text: Loved Luzia!  Thankful it was air-conditioned in the middle of August!  Amazing show.  The strength and agility of the performers is beautiful to watch.

reviews.title: Mouth-Gapingly Beautiful
text: The Tall Guy and I had front row centre tickets for this event but it didn't matter -- you could sit anywhere in this big-top tent and have a fabulous view.  My face hurt from smiling, my palms were sore from clapping, and I was going hoarse from shouting "Bravo".  Highly recommended for children and adults of all ages.

reviews.title: Highly recommend this wonderful experience
text: WOW! Was taken here for a family trip (kids in there 20s) and everyone loved it! All the acts were amazing, the performances were phenomenal, even the musical score was brilliant. Going in not sure what to expect and came out in disbelief by how wonderful it was. Currently id say this is one of the best things to do in Toronto. I would definitely go see this again. Very intimate seating for everyone (although try to get centre seats). It also features the top contortionist in the world and some other amazing and talented performers. The end of the performance left me with chills. Definitely a 5/5, 10/10, A+ experience!

reviews.title: Artistic, Imaginative & Full of Surprises
text: This is my sixth Cirque Show I've seen.  I've seen them in my city and also have seen some in Vegas.
This show wowed our group and at times made us so nervous with the stunts it made us hold our breath!  As with all Cirque shows show up in your seat a few minutes early to see a brief preshow.

This show was colorful & stretched your imagination of what can be possible artistically on stage.  The highlight for me was the mechanized waterfall integrated into the show performances.  I had no idea water could do that on stage!!

The costumes were detailed and the sets were bright & attention grabbing.  There was a piece where a character interacts playfully with the audience in a competition and everyone got into it. So much fun!

I don't want to give away all the surprises of this show.  See this show if you can.  Signing up for the free Cirque club will help you get some offers for discounted tickets the next time the show comes in town.

reviews.title: Luzia cirque de soleil
text: Maybe I don't have much of an imagination but I've been more entertained by contortionists and acrobats on America's got Talent.  The cast on stage spent most of their time watching another cast member flip off a swing.  The gentlemen on the leather straps very strong but he stops to pet a fake tiger. It seemed silly.  Truth I've seen more entertaining shows on a cruise ship.

reviews.title: Super Night
text: The magic of Cirque du Soleil never ceases to amaze me.  The show is entertaining from start to finish and the whole performance is a feast for the eyes.  Magnificent, inspiring and fun.  It brings a smile to the face of everyone in the room regardless of age.

reviews.title: A Mexico Dream
text: Luzia is another great performance from Cirque du Soleil. If you've been in Mexico you wil notice that the show is based on mexican culture, music and traditions. The performers are increadibly amazing. The songs transports you to a diferent world. Be careful when buy your tkts: they have a splash zone and you may get wet. The clown is amazingly fun and will bring back your childhood. Hungry? The hot dogs are a great option and you can try also Churros with Nutela (delish!).

reviews.title: Marvelous! Amazing! Stunning! Magic!
text: This was my first time in the Cirque Du Solei. It was an amazing experience! The show was fantastic in every sense. The music was splendid and the performers (all of them) were simply stunning. What I liked the most was the Mexican theme. The singer was fantastic. I also enjoyed the colors, the rain, the flowers, the robots, and the animals (in special the horse) in the play. I loved the energy and the passion transmitted by every single member of the cirque. This is a must see show. Thanks!

reviews.title: Outstanding
text: We have been to many Cirque Du Soleil shows, including in Las Vegas, this is one of the best! Loved the theme, the music, the acts, the set up, everything! Highly recommended it!

reviews.title: A little disappointed.
text: While this was fairly well done, I was disappointed that there was not more circus.  With the mexican theme, the language was spanish.  What there was of the circus performers was excellent, however more would have been better.  Did not really enjoy the singing, It was well performed, but could not understand what was being sung.

reviews.title: Not like any of their of their Vegas or Orlando shows, it is just so-so.
text: Family or 6, with teens and grandparents. I have seen over 5 different shows from Las Vegas to Orlando, this was my first Big top (Tent) show, but never again. It rained, and even the restrooms are outside, unless you are a a 100% clear skies, it could ruis an evening. Once inside, we had front row seats, to the sides, and the stage props obstructs a good chuck of the performance, (they should have thought of this), specially during the clown's appearance, which is often, and among the best parts. If you have ever seen any of their shows, this will fall so far bellow expectations. do not spend more than $65-$75, AND any-seat-at that price will be provide equally good viewing. it is a good show, for someone who has never seen their indoor shows.

reviews.title: One of the best Cirque shows!
text: Seen more than 10 Cirque du Soleil shows and this was one of the best.  High energy, great music, bright, fast paced - fun!

reviews.title: Great show but uncomfortable small seats
text: We absolutely loved this show, it was exciting, innovative, and just overall spectacular. I do have to mention that we saw this touring show in Costa Mesa, California. The contortionist will make you squirm but honestly you cannot stop watching him. Every aspect of the show left us in awe. I absolutely recommend it. Even though I gave it a 5 rating I do have to admit that the seating was the worst I have ever experienced. While the location of our seats were perfect, they were very small and I was pressed against the people on both my right and left. I was in physical pain for most of the show. The seats would be perfect for small children but for adults they are not adequate, especially. I was in between two bigger guys and I am not small my self. I noticed people of average weight having the same problem, being squished together. Even with the bad seating situation and physical pain, I still recommend seeing the show.

reviews.title: My best recent Cirque du Soleil experience
text: I have not been to many Cirque du Soleil shows and couldn't remember the earlier ones. The Luzia is definitely the best experience to me personally from the show experiences I remember. I went to the show in Atlanta where they are performing from September through November. It's the 3rd shows I attended in a tent which is always the best venue to experience a circus. In Luzia, each performance was well connected smoothly. I loved the music and the Spanish songs. The water element and acrobatic complexity on stage were astonishing. The master and all performers did a fantastic job on stage as well as interaction with the audiences. I recommended it to my friends and colleagues. Kudos to all performers and workers behind the scene. They made it happened.

reviews.title: One of my least favorite Cirque shows
text: I consider myself a Cirque du Soleil connoisseur of sorts; Luzia is the 7th? Cirque show I've seen. At this point, I only see Cirque shows in the tent because I've realized the caliber of the show is significantly better when in a tent. Now, I must be honest: Luzia was one of my least favorite shows I've seen, despite it being in a tent. Whelp, there goes my theory. Perhaps we should've waited longer to see the show; it was only the show's second night in Seattle. Everything about this show did not live up to my expectations. In addition, the last, and arguably biggest, scene was a complete dud and the performers stopped a quarter of the way through and just stood there until there was an announcement that the show was temporarily paused. I heard a performer was injured the night before but I don't see why that act couldn't run smoothly the following night.
In sum, definitely go see a Cirque show, but not this one.

reviews.title: Exciting juggling and acrobatics
text: Went to see Luzia at end of run in San Francisco; got cheaper tickets that way. At $75, a better deal than years past and seats very good in Level 2.  The shows had 2 missing acrobatic acts, so more fill-in singing and perhaps clown.  Juggling is very fast and dynamic, even 5 clubs juggled at breakneck pace.  Nice use of treadmills and computerized waterfall patterns.  The contortionist is male this time, most impressive.  Worth seeing!

reviews.title: This circus is in a tent
text: Really loved that they had the perform under a tent to really give you the feel of a circus. Buy a popcorn/pretzel from the concession stand to complete the experience.
Best seats are in the middle but I think second best wound be to the ones on the left of the stage. Truth be told I didn't understand the story but enjoyed watching the performance.
PS: The theme may be of Mexico but there is hindi music for one of the performances. Try to find in which one.

reviews.title: Great but prefer more acrobacies
text: I love Cirque du Soleil, their creativity, colors, music, performances are amazing. And eventhough Luzia is a great show, i found it short in acrobacies compared to Totem that i saw a few years ago. But it's totally worth it, the Cirque du soleil is a full-person circus, no animals are harmed, and you'll get amazed by all the things they can do.

reviews.title: Return to Childhood
text: The Cirque de Soleil is a circus for adults. Children are also welcome. l still remember the clowns, the trapeze acts, the jugglers and the animals roaring away from their cages, the horses dancing around the ring and that omnipresent character with his whip - the Ring Master.
What thrills, what enjoyment, what memories!

And now after decades, a return to that childhood, albeit in a much more spectacular atmosphere. It's all there - the Ring Master, the clowns, the jugglers and the amazing trapeze acts. Plus much much more. The only thing missing are the animals - they are protected now and unavailable. But not to worry. Paper Machie tigers, horses and other animals prance around the ring keeping you entertained.
And it is spectacular. Lights, sets, the thrills set your pulse racing and keep you at the edge of the seat throughout the couple of hours that keep you totally engaged.
Thank you so much for the wonderful experience. An experience I shall repeat next year again.

reviews.title: Luzia - Cirque de Soleil Amazing Show
text: While visiting Downtown Toronto, 4 of us went to see Cirque de Soleils show Luzia- A Waking Dream of Mexico.We were seated in great seats in this wonderful big top tent. The overall atmosphere was magical, the performers were brilliant and the accompanying music was great. You have to see some of these acts to believe them, you actually leave the show asking yourself 'did that really happen'. Impossible to describe what one witnessed to others, only advice I can give is, go and witness this for yourself, you will not be disappointed, magical.

reviews.title: The worst show I have ever seen
text: One star goes to the few acrobats that actually did something, the rest of the people/actors were just standing on there in rediculus costiums.
I am so angry with myself that I wasted money for that.

reviews.title: Wow...wow...wow
text: I thought the whole show was incredible. My son - age 16 and I were awestruck for the entire show. Incredible talent, set, etc. Royal Albert hall alway a fabulous Venue too with great all
Round views. An absolute must for all.

reviews.title: My first cirque du soleil....
text: My first cirque du soleil Experience and I loved every second of it. Funny, amazing, breathtaking and charming it was everything I wanted and more! Highly recommended! Also great venue!

reviews.title: Really disappointed
text: The Albert Hall was lovely and well organised for wheelchair access but the show was a big disappointment. Im a big fan of other Cirque du Soliel shows but not this one. The comic might have appealed to a 10 year old, but not an adult. A couple of the acrobats were good but not enough to cover a whole show.

reviews.title: Disappointing
text: Went to the first night of the London show yesterday and I have to say we were disappointed. Some of the acrobatic turns were good but the comedy turns weren't funny at all and many of the acts were simple with a lot of mistakes made. Considering all and especially what we paid for the tickets we expected a lot better.

reviews.title: Luiza
text: Credits to the performers they did amazing (5 stars there) but organizers charge 6 dollars for water and some costumes were ripped (not intentional for this show) and just looked cheap. Cirques performers do their best but at the Vancouver show you could see the lack of quality from the company. Overall enjoyed ther performers but didn’t enjoy the companies experience that was meant to compliment it, could use a refresh and like a lot less bitchier staff.

reviews.title: Poor Facility (Vancouver Oct. 26/2019)
text: The theater was HOT (as in temperature). It was a relief when the show was over to go back outside and cool off. The seats were very narrow with very little leg room (the seats must have been designed for kids in mind vs. adults). Everyone's' shoulders were touching. Your legs were almost touching the seats in front of you. All this distracted me from watching most of the show. At intermission, all of the bathroom were long. I over heard many people saying "I don't need to go that bad" after seeing how long the line ups were. More bathrooms were needed for the volume of people.
From the parts of the show I was able to watch, it was alright. It was not the best Cirque Du Soleil I've seen (not even close). There was no plot what so ever and it seemed to be all random.
I was not impressed.

reviews.title: It was ok...
text: I went last night and the show was just...ok. The acrobats were amazing and the production was great but it seemed like the same thing was happening over and over and over again. We ended up leaving early because it was kinda repetitive and I've honestly seen better shows than this one. They tried to add comedy here and there. I may have have chuckled just to be nice but it just wasn't my style of comedy. I probably wouldn't go back but it's nice for a family outing or date night.

reviews.title: Its wonderful
text: The water, the candles, the music is a look in Mexico diversity, really something to watch!!! Is not my favorite circus solei show, but its great!!

reviews.title: Great Father's Day gift!
text: My husband has been to a few shows, only one other myself, and we love going to their traveling tent, it makes the experience so much more magical.

The restrooms are great for port-a-potties but would be terrible in bad weather, thankfully our day was beautiful. Make sure to bring lots of extra money for concessions ($8 cotton candy but free refills on popcorn) and gift shop, but there are many options and the staff is very helpful if something doesn't work after buying!
All seats will have a good view because of the tent structure, but we like side of stage front of second section for best appreciation without being too close.
Cast members are always going around to include you in the magic and our three girls loved everything from start to finish! While there just let yourself go and be amazed.

Pro tip - after buying a $6 water we found the water bubbler near a side entrance that the cast members use between acts. We were able to refill cool water during the show to save a bit, so arrive early to stalk out the tent!
